thief-1.text: Hey, nice threads. I take it you spoke to the professor? Curious that he invited me here, given my...background.

responses.thief-2: Who are you and what IS your background?
responses.thief-3: How do you know the professor?
Tell me again, why are you here?

end-1.message: I think I could use your help. Join me?

thief-2.text: You can call me Elizabeth...Smith. Or just Beth. But you call me Betty, and this knife will find its way close to a part of you you value... I have nimble fingers, and I'm light on my feet. People...especially the wealthy...tend to find things go missing when I'm around...(she winks).

responses.thief-3: Ahh, I'll try to remember that...Beth. So do you know the professor personally?

end-1.message: Hmmm, I think you could be of use. How about you join me?

end-2.message: Sorry, I uhh, need to go. Maybe we'll talk later.

thief-3.text: I took one of his classes when I was at the university here a few years ago. We had a certain rapport...He helped keep me out of trouble, at least trouble with others anyway...(she gives you a sly smile).

responses.thief-2: Ah, I see. A side of Professor Nymian I haven't seen before. And what's your name?

end-1.message: I think we can help each other. Why don't you join me?

end-2.message: Maybe you can tell me more about that later, but I need to go.

thief-4.text: Sorry, hon, but I don't work well with so many people. Come get me when it's just you. Or maybe two of you, and then we could be a ménage à trois...(she grins).

responses.thief-6: I don't have need of you now.

thief-6.text: Ok, I'll be around the museum if you need me again.
